result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D. Starks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: 9:45 AM  Defendant Michael D. Starks in court.  Attorney Jason D Sanders in court for Michael D. Starks.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters guilty plea.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Presentence investigation waived.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on probation for 2 years.  Defendant to complete ay assessments and comply with any treatment recommended.  Court orders restitution to Walmart of $2085.80. Credit for 4 days.  Felony warnings given.
Notice of Hearing for Calendar Call on October 21, 2022 at 9:00AM-NOT DELIVERABLE AS ADDRESSED, UNABLE TO FORWARD, RETURN TO SENDER (Michael Starks)
